loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is from Tabid, Ozamis City. She is 52 years old. Felicisima is cohabiting and has three children. To make a living, Felicisima runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Felicisima has been in this business for 12 years and earns 1,300 PHP a month for these activities.

Felicisima is requesting a loan of 2,300 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. Earlier this year, Felicisima joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio Josè, padre de dos niños menores de edad, desde pequeño ha realizado actividades en el campo,solicita su 1er crèdito para establecer pasto mejorado y comprar  semilla variendad Brisanta, trabaja en coordinaciòn con su papà, quien es dueños de su propia finca; Silvio espera efectuar la siembra de mas àrea de pasto para garantizar la alimentación de su hato ganadero en periodo de verano; su principal actividad son agricultura y ganadería;  en su comunidad tiene buen record comercial, tiene buena conducta, trabajador, responsable.
texts.en:
Silvio José is the father of two minor children.  He has worked in the fields since he was a little boy.  He works with his father, who is the owner of his own farm.  

He is requesting his first loan to establish improved pasture and to buy the Brizantha variety of seed.

Silvio hopes to plant more area of pasture to guarantee the nourishment of his herd of livestock in the summer period.  His principal jobs are agriculture and livestock.  In his community he has a good business record.  He has good behavior and is hardworking and responsible.

loans.use: to establish his pasture.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en la provincia de Cartago. La Ciudad de Cartago fue fundada en 1563 por el conquistador español Juan Vázquez de Coronado, fungió como capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823 y fue sede de la primera corte internacional permanente de la historia mundial, la Corte de Cartago. Su relieve montañoso está formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca.

El necesita una motocicleta ya que trabaja como fontanero y necesita trasladarse de un sector a otro ya que son distancias largas, esto le facilitará el trabajo. Además  le es muy importante adquirir este medio de transporte, ya que la demanda es cada vez más fuerte y los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Oscar es un crédito de setecientos cincuenta mil colones (¢750.000)  para comprar una motocicleta para movilizarse a su trabajo todos los días, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Oscar forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Oscar is thirty-three and lives with his family in the community of Santa Teresita in the province of Cartago.  The city of Cartago was founded in 1563 by Spanish conquistador Juan Vásquez de Coronado.  It acted as the Costa Rican capital until 1823 and was the seat of the first permanent international court in history, the Court of Cartago.  Its mountainous relief formed by two ranges, the Central and the Talamanca.

Oscar needs a motorcycle because he's a plumber and needs to transport himself long distances from one place to another, and the bike will make his job easier.  Getting this kind of transportation is also important because the neighbors have been very satisfied with his service and demand is becoming stronger and stronger.

At this time Oscar is seeking a loan for 750,000 colones to buy a motorcycle to get to work every day and to give the best support and attention to his job.

Oscar is a member of the El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba Communal Bank, one of EDESA's 150 member organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be Oscar's first loan and he says that he hopes to be able to continue growing as a micro entrepreneur and to make the business a success.  He also stresses that thanks to these kinds of organizations and their facilitation of credit he is able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use:
compra de motocicleta para trasladarse a los lugares de trabajo 
to buy a motorcycle to get himself to job sites.

location.town: El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba

loans.name: Maria Nuestra Señora - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. LIDIA de 56 años de edad, casada con hijo, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “MARIA NUESTRA SEÑORA – EL TAMBO” grupo conformado por 10 personas. 
LIDIA se dedica a la venta de productos  y ventas de  lácteos como yogurt, bebidas, quesos, mermeladas, etc. Vende en el mercado de su localidad, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ascendió sus  ingresos económicos. 
El préstamo solicito para la compra de  productos primarios como la leche de vaca, para su elaboración de lácteos.   
Sus objetivos para el futuro son comprar su automóvil. Ella está ubicada la primera persona  lado izquierda viste con chompa color marrón y puesta un lentes.
texts.en:
Lidia, 56, is married and has a son.  She’s currently a member of the “María Nuestra Señora-El Tambo” communal bank which has ten members.

Lidia sells dairy products like yoghurt, beverages, cheese, marmalades, etc.  She sells in a market in her location.  Thanks to her effort and dedication her income has risen.

She asked for the loan to buy raw materials like cow’s milk to make her dairy products.  Her objective for the future is to buy a car.  

She is the first person on the left wearing a brown jacket and wearing glasses.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a carenderia (cafe) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her 'carenderia' business. 

Generosa has been in this business for 40 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Generosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional food ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ayaba  Adèle  C.

texts.fr: Agée de 30ans, Ayaba Adèle C. vit avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Elle distribue des pagnes dans sa localité et ses environs. Dans le but de diversifier son activité, elle sollicite et obtient un micro crédit à Finadev afin de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de maximiser son profit. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de faire face aux dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Ayaba Adèle C., age 30, lives with her husband and her two children. She sells "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) in her town and its surroundings.

With the goal of diversifying her business, she sought and obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, in order to bolster her buying power and maximize her profits.

Her subsequent earnings will enable her to take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 15 pagnes (colorful African cloth) of all quality

loans.name: Marjely Ledenia

texts.es: Marjely , pequeña comerciante de la zona, cuenta con el apoyo de  su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar. se dedica a comprar y vender ropa americana desde hace 4 años; aprendio a trabajar en este negocio por su mamá que tambien vendia ropa; Marjely solicita 1er crèdito para comprar  ropa Americana, con el proposito de aumentar su inventario de su tramo esta localizado en el mercado municipal, así brindar mejor servicio y satisfacer la demanda de los usuaros, en su comunidad es considerada como una persona responsable, trabajadora con mucho deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Marjely, a small businesswoman in the area, has the help of her husband, who takes care of the household expenses.  She has worked buying and selling clothing from the United States for four years.  She learned to work in this business from her mother, who also was selling clothing.

Marjely is requesting her first loan to buy clothing from the U. S., with the goal of increasing the inventory in her spot located in the local market, and so give better service and satisfy the demand of her customers.

In her community she is considered to be a responsible and hardworking person with a great desire for improvement.

loans.use: to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Juanito is from Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 39 years old. Juanito is married and has one child. To make a living, Juanito makes and sells snack foods. Juanito has been in his business for 2 year and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Juanito joined GDMPC. Juanito is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy meats, hot dogs and other snack items to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy meats, hot dogs and other snack items to sell

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: Cuisinière de formation, Delphine est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle associe à sa profession la vente des mèches, chaussures, pagnes et produits cosmétiques dans un quartier populaire de Cotonou. En vue d'accroître son stock et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle sollicite un concours à Finadev afin de maximiser son profit et de participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
A trained cook, Delphine is married and the mother of two children. As a secondary business, she sells hair extensions, shoes, pagnes (colorful African cloth) and cosmetics, in a working class neighborhood in Cotonou.

In order to bolster her stock and meet customer demand, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, to maximize her profits and take part in covering the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 50 pieces of hair extensions, 30 cosmetic products, and 15 pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Banco Mujer Damas De Fé Group

texts.es:
Doña Leonor es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer  Damas de Fé,  ella es una mujer de 48 años madre de 4 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, y vive solamente con su esposo y su papá un adulto mayor que necesita de muchos cuidados, ya que está muy enfermo. Por diversas situaciones familiares, a ella se le hace muy difícil salir a trabajar, para ayudar a los gastos del hogar, por eso hace bastante tiempo empezó a criar cerdos en su casa, y venderlos en su misma comunidad. 
Este es el tercer crédito que solicita Leonor, y los anteriores le han permitido hacerle inyecciones de capital de trabajo a su pequeña empresa, como compra de cerdos, concentrados, vitaminas. Ella sabe lo importante que son los préstamos para su negocio, y  la oportunidad que tienen de generar ingresos para su familia, superarse y mejorar la calidad. 
En el grupo junto a Doña Leonor están 8 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Leonor is one of the members of the "Banco Mujer Damas de Fé" communal bank. She is a woman of 48, and the mother of four children, who are all adults. She lives only with her husband and her father, who is elderly and needs a lot of care, as he is very ill. 

For various family reasons, it has been very difficult for her to go out to work in order to help with the household expenses. That's why some time ago she started to raise pigs in her house, and sell them in her community. 

This is the third loan Leonor is applying for, and the previous ones have allowed her to inject working capital into her small company, through the  purchase of pigs, concentrates and vitamins. She knows how important the loans are for her business, and the opportunity they provide for generating income for her family, for self-improvement, and for improving quality. 

In the group with Leonor are eight other members who are going to invest in farming and livestock raising.

loans.use: To buy pigs, concentrate, and vitamins.

loans.name: Tezalia

texts.es:
Tezalia, de 63 años de edad, es una mujer  trabajadora  y empeñosa, además de solidaria y amable con muchos deseos de superación.  Es  conviviente con  Ilario  quien se dedica al transporte, fruto de esa unión tiene 1 hija Lily de 29 años de edad. Juntos viven en compañía de 2 nietos a los que quieren mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Tezalia es el dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un motocarro que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros más un crédito particular. Cuando empezaron, alquilaron el vehículo, pero al darse cuenta que lo deterioraban por el mal uso, decidió con su pareja, que él manejaría y realizaría el servicio. Es así que hacce más de 2 años compró su primera unidad, y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando y comprando otras unidades más. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual pueda solventar sus gastos familiares. Pero lo que no le gusta es cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver buenas resultados. 
Por tanto, tiene planes de crecer y poder comprarse otras unidades de motottaxis así ampliar su flota. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues se lleva bien con todos sus miembros a los que considera ser buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos de motocarro como llantas, renovar el asiento posterior y cambiar el toldo del techo, debido a que las lluvias lo ha deteriorado. Asimismo pagar los servicios del mecánico para el mantenimiento respectivo.
texts.en:
Tezalia, 63, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who is also very supportive and kind with a strong wish to get ahead.  She lives with Ilario who provides transportation.  They have a daughter, Lily, 29.  They live together comfortably in their own house with two grandchildren who they love very much.

Tezalia’s activity is providing passenger transportation services with a vehicle she bought with her savings plus a private loan.  When she started out, she leased out the vehicle but noting that poor care led to its deterioration, she and her husband decided that it would be better if he drove it and provided the service.  So over two years ago she bought her first vehicle and in time has been renovating and buying others.  She likes her business because it allows her to have income to cover family expenses.  But she doesn’t like it when her mototaxi breaks down often because this causes many expenses.  Even so, she manages to get good results.

Therefore, she plans to grow and to be able to buy more mototaxis to expand her fleet.  This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s been getting to reach all her objectives.  She also comments that she feels comfortable in her communal bank because she gets along well with all the members who she considers to be good people.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy spare parts for her vehicle like tires, to reupholster the rear seat, replace the entire canvas top because it’s rain damaged.  She will also pay the mechanic to do this work.

loans.use: to buy tires, reupholster the rear seat, replace the canvas top and pay the mechanic.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
This is Benita, 55, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a driver, and a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                       
      
Benita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Benita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yambio. She sells breads, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est un homme âgé de  32ans. Il est marié å un/e restauratrice. Il a 02 enfants, tous  à l’école. Le premier a 07 ans et le dernier a 05ans.
Kodjo travaille comme technicien bâtiment depuis 2005. Il exerce son activité  dans un atelier et travaille avec 02 personnes. Sa difficulté principale est le délestage électrique par moment.
Kodjo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter réaménager son atelier. Il veut augmenter son épargne. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kodjo voudrait acheter une nouvelle machine pour le tirage des plans. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Kodjo, age 32, is married to a restaurant owner. He has two children, who both go to school. The first one is seven, the last one is five years old.

Kodjo has been working as a building technician since 2006. He runs his business in a workshop with two other persons. His main difficulties are due to the power outages that occur from time to time.

Kodjo is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to resupply his workshop. He wants to increase his savings.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to buy a new printer for blueprints. He says that, with his profits, he intends to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to resupply his workshop

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est une femme âgée de 28ans. Elle est mariée à un fonctionnaire de police et 02enfants tous scolarisés. Les enfants ont 09ans et 07ans. Essi est revendeuse de pagnes à toutes personnes. Elle exerce son activité de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son quatrième crédit lui permettra d’acheter plus de pagnes pour satisfaire la demande de ses nombreux clients. Elle désire dans l’avenir gérer une boutique de pagnes et être en mesure d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Essi is a 28-year-old woman who is married to a police department employee. She has two children, both in school. The children are 9 and 7 years old. Essi sells <i>pagnes<i/> (colorful West African cloth). She operates her business door to door and gets her supplies in Lomé. 

Her fourth loan will enable her to buy more <i>pagne<i/> cloth to meet the demands of her numerous customers. She would like to manage a <i>pagne<i/> store in the future and to ensure she can cover the schooling costs for her children over time.

loans.use: to buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi est une femme âgée de 35ans. Elle est mariée à un professeur et vend des sacs (friperie).Son activité se déroule à la maison et elle s’approvisionne au marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs afin de satisfaire les demandes de la famille. Elle veut agrandir son stock dans l’avenir et prendre soin de sa famille. Elle a démarré l’activité en 2009.
texts.en:
Akuvi, age 35, is married to a teacher and sells secondhand backpacks. She gets her supplies at the market in Hédzranawoé.

She's seeking her first loan, to be used to buy backpacks in order to satisfy the needs of her family.

She wants to bolster her stock in the future, and take care of her family. She started her business in 2009.

loans.use: to buy secondhand backpacks

loans.name: Laura Rosa

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Laura montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 3 hijos, pues el padre de sus hijos los abandonó hace un tiempo sin hacer alguna contribución económica para su sustento. La actividad la aprendió haciendo algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. Con sus trabajos, Laura ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. Con la finalidad de responder a un gran pedido que le ha hecho un cliente, Laura busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos que requiere para la confección como son agujas, hilos y telas y poder así responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

Laura espera que así siga creciendo su negocio y su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y un estudio de mejor calidad. Además, Laura espera que si su negocio sigue creciendo a este ritmo, en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales y siga así sacando sus 3 hijos adelante.
texts.en:
With a lot of capital, Laura set up her sewing workshop to make money to maintain the house she lives in with her three children, whose father abandoned them a while back without leaving any money for their support.  Laura learned her craft by taking some courses which allowed her to do jobs that are noted for high quality and punctual delivery.

Laura has managed to capture a large number of clients with her work, guaranteeing good monthly sales.  She hopes business will keep growing and later allow her to create jobs for others in greater need.  Having finished a large order from a client, Laura is looking for a loan to make it possible to buy the sewing supplies she needs, like needles, thread, and fabric so she can fill orders that have been put in by her clients.

Laura hopes that this way she can keep growing the business, and her family can enjoy better income that will permit a higher quality of life and education.  In addition, Laura hopes that if the business keeps growing at this rate, she can create at least one job for someone who needs work and doesn't have job prospects, and keep getting her children ahead in the process.

loans.use: to buy the sewing supplies she needs, like needles, thread, and fabric, and to be able to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Laura Piedad

texts.es:
Laura Piedad tiene 19 años de edad es casada no tiene hijos, vive con el esposo en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC MUSHUC ÑAN está ubicada en la comunidad Guanto Cruz parroquia Guanujo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 11 socios y socias se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Laura Piedad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, mora, además se dedican a la cría de pollos, cerdos, ganado. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, herbicidas, líquidos para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda.

El sueño  es poder estudiar y culminar una carrera. El desafío al que se presenta es el mal clima y el transporte. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli y disfrutar de la época de la navidad.
texts.en:
Laura Piedad, 19, is married and has no children; she lives with her husband in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  She is a member of the “Mushuc Ñan” communal bank located in the community of Guanto Cruz, Guanujo Parish, and 60 minutes from the office.  It has 11 members, both male and female who farm blackberries and corn and raise small farm animals and dairy cows to make cheese.  Laura Piedad farms corn, potatoes and blackberries and also raises chickens, pigs and cattle.

She is asking for the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, urea, herbicide and weed killers.  With support from the loan she’ll be able to buy the supplies.  Her purchases and sales take place in Guaranda.

Her dream is to be able to study and complete a career.  The challenges she faces are bad weather and transportation.  In her free time she likes to play volleyball and to enjoy the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, urea, herbicide and weed killers.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Yusufu from Waterloo - the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children between the ages of 7 months and 7 years.

Yusufu runs local food stuff; he sells palm oil, groundnut, gari and beans. He has been running this business for 15 years. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm, 7 days per week. He says his business is the only source of income he has and he lives in a single room with his wife and children. He says that the main challenge to his business is transportation cost.

Yusufu has requested a loan in order to buy more local food stuff such as palm oil, ground nut, and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his older child and take care of the younger child. In the future, he plans to build a big house. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food stuff such as palm oil, groundnut, and gari.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Regina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
This is Esmeralda, 62, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nolasco, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Esmeralda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esmeralda hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Jaime Ulises

texts.es:
Jaime, es originario de El Consuelo una comunidad de Estelí, se dedica a la siembras de café , su nivel de escolaridad es bien básico solo finalizo la primaria. El es casado, tiene tres hijos los tres son adolecentes y están estudiando la secundaria. Inicio sus actividades hace 6 años cuando regreso de Costa Rica con lo que logro ahorrar compro una manzana de tierra y fue cuando comenzó a cultivar café aunque es un rubro caro de cultivar pero es un producto que tiene mucha demanda en especial el café orgánico que se siembra en la zona norte del país donde la mayoría de su población incluso a los turistas lo primero que piden comprar es una buena taza de café orgánico donde su textura, su sabor y olor es toda una tentación , el trabaja junto con su esposa en los cultivos. El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para siembra, pago  de mano de obra para sembrar 1 ½ manzana de café orgánico.
 Pues desea tener una cosecha con muy buenos rendimientos y sobre todo de muy buena calidad para poderlo vender a un buen precio. Su expectativa es lograr ampliar las aéreas de siembra de café y mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos y que puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Jaime is from El Consuelo, a community in Estelí. He is a coffee farmer. Jaime has only a basic level of schooling; he finished elementary school. He is married with three adolescent children who are all in high school. Six years ago, when he returned from Costa Rica, he started his farm using his savings to buy 1.73 acres of land. This was when he started to cultivate coffee. Coffee farming is an expensive venture, but coffee-especially the organic coffee sown in the northern part of the country- is in high demand. In the north, the majority of the population, as well as all of the tourists, are always in search of a good cup of organic coffee whose texture, flavour and aroma is intoxicating. Jaime works with his wife in the fields. He is requesting a loan for the  purchase of supplies for sowing, and to pay labourers to sow 2.5 acres of organic coffee.
Jaime wants to have a high-yielding harvest that is, above all, high quality. This way, he will be able to sell it at a good price. His hope is to expand his coffee plantation and improve his children's quality of life, allowing them to continue to study.

loans.use: to buy supplies for sowing; to pay labourers to sow 2.5 acres of organic coffee.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
Jose es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad. Jose hace poco se divorció de la madre de sus hijos y el ha quedado a cargo del cuidado y sostenimiento de sus 2 hijos, por lo que últimamente ha venido trabajando fuertemente para poder generar los ingresos suficientes que les permita tener una buena calidad de vida. Jose se dedica desde hace ya bastante tiempo al servicio de banquetes, donde ofrece comidas, decoración, sonido, fotografía, bebidas y demás. Gracias a este trabajo, ha podido generar los ingresos con los que sostiene los gastos de su hogar y con los cuales les ha brindado a sus 2 hijos todo lo necesario. En búsqueda de que su negocio siga creciendo cada vez más, Jose busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de artículos de decoración, cristalería y vajillas con los que pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

De esta manera, Jose podrá captar un mayor número de clientes al hacer su negocio más atractivo y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio. Además, Jose podrá ir cumpliendo poco a poco su sueño de tener una gran casa de banquetes en un local propio y donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes el mejor servicio de su municipio.
texts.en:
José is a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking and always wanting to offer his children a good quality of life and access to a better quality education.  José recently was divorced from his children’s mother and he’s in charge of his two children’s care and support so he has been working very hard lately to generate sufficient income to have a good quality of life.  

For some time now, José has been providing banquet services; he offers food, decoration, sound, photography, beverages and more.  Thanks to this work he’s been able to generate income to cover household expenses and to be able to give his two children everything necessary.  Seeking to make his business grow more each time, José is looking for a loan that will give him the opportunity to buy decorations, crystal ware and dinnerware to offer better service to his customers.

In this way, José will be able to capture a larger number of customers by making his business more attractive and by being able to offer a better service.  In addition, José will gradually be approaching his dream of having a great banquet center in a place of his own where he can offer his customers the best service in his town.

loans.use: to buy decorative items, glassware and dinnerware.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que ha tenido que superar grandes adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar y salir adelante le han permitido superar las dificultades y seguir progresando junto a su hijo. Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 12 años a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. Maria, con el ánimo de poder generar ingresos luego de haberse quedado desempleada, decidió montar una tienda general donde ofrece toda clase de productos de la canasta familiar. En la tienda ya lleva aproximadamente 5 años y desde ese momento ha tenido la oportunidad de brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad. Su tienda ha crecido cada vez más impulsada principalmente por la buena atención y los buenos productos que Maria ofrece a sus clientes, sin embargo, el poco capital con el que fue montado su negocio, sumado a otras dificultades que se le han presentado en el camino, han hecho que su tienda aún tenga algunas dificultades para ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Es por esto que Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Maria espera que con mayor variedad su negocio siga creciendo y sea más atractivo para los clientes. Además, Maria sueña con tener mayores ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecer un futuro económico estable a su hijo.
texts.en:
María is a person who has had to overcome great adversities in her life.  However, her desire to work and to get ahead has permitted her to overcome the difficulties and continue making progress alongside her children.

María is a single mother head of household.  She has a 12 year old son who she has always wanted to provide a good quality of life and greater opportunities for progress to.  

When she became unemployed, aiming to earn good income María decided to set up a general store where she sells all sorts of basic staple items.  She’s had the store for approximately five years now and since she started it she’s been able to offer her son a better quality of life and access to a better quality education.  

Her store has grown more each time basically thanks to the good service and good products María offers her customers.  However, the little capital with which the store was set up added to other difficulties that have arisen along the way have caused her store to have some difficulty in offering a wider variety of products to her customers.  This is why María is looking for a loan that will give her the possibility of being able to purchase basic staple items to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

María hopes that with a wider variety of products her store will continue to grow and be more attractive to customers.  In addition, María dreams with earning higher income that will lead to a better quality of life and to be able to offer her son a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín es de la comarca la laguna- teustepe, casado, tiene 3 hijas,dos están a su cargo y la mayor es independiente. Empezo a trabajar a los 12 años de edad ayudándole al papa en el campo, después decidió trabajar por si solo buscando financiamiento en otras instituciones .El se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz que unas vez cosechada lo lleva a vender a Managua para poder pagar mano de obra  ya que no tiene ayuda de nadie pues es solo.  Hoy quiere el préstamo para comprar la semilla del frijol, los insumos y el abono que utilizara en la siembra. El  espera que le vaya bien y obtener  ganancia de la cosecha para  pagar el crédito y comprarse  un pedazo de tierra.
texts.en: Efraín is from the region of La Laguna - Teustepe. He is married and has 3 daughters. Two of them are still in his care, and the oldest is independent. He started working at the age of 12, helping his father in the fields. Later he decided to work independently, seeking financing from other institutions. He works growing beans and corn, and once they are harvested he takes them to Managua to sell, so he can pay for labor, since he is alone and does not have help from anyone. Now he wants the loan to buy bean seeds, supplies and the fertilizer he will use for planting. He hopes that it will go well for him and he will obtain profits from the harvest to pay off the loan and buy himself a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, supplies and the fertilizer he will use for planting.

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla is 50 years old. She lives with her seven children in Montol, Ozamis City. Rosavilla manufactures dried cassava chips ("binangkol") which is used in producing/making chalk. For five years she's been in this work and she gets a revenue of 1,200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2008. Now she's taking out a loan of 2,100 PHP which will be used to purchase more cassava. She's hoping for business growth and progress.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava

loans.name: Silvia Geily

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es casa tiene dos hijos pequeños de edad, esta viviendo en casa de su mama, quien se encuentra enferma y es quien la esta cuidando. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar muebles de clínica que su mama necesita para moverse como es una cama especial, silla de ruedas y un sanitario para enfermos, ya que esta lastimada de la columna vertebral y por su edad esta muy delicada.
Desea que su mama se mejor de su enfermedad y con la ayuda de estos muebles sea más fácil no lastimar y que sea más rápida la recuperación de su mama. 
Planea pagar el crédito con la pensión que reciben del gobierno, y su esposo le ayudara con los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabaja con una institución del gobierno.
texts.en:
Silvia is married and has two young children.  She is living in the house of her mother, who is sick, and Silvia is caring for her.
 
She is requesting the loan to buy hospital furniture that her mother needs to move.  These are a special bed, a wheelchair, and a hospital commode.

Her mother hurt her spine and is very delicate because of her age.  Silvia wants her mother to improve from her illness, for this furniture to make it easier for her not to hurt herself, and for her mother's recuperation to be quick.

She plans to pay back the loan with the pension she receives from the government.  Her husband will help her with the family expenses with the salary he receives from his job with a government institution.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old and married. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a retail store, selling some fruits and food products. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Edna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to buy more fruits and food items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and food items to sell

loans.name: Najenty

texts.en:
Najenty lives in Yambio. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children; both of them are still in school. 

Najenty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Narciza Del Rocío

texts.es:
Narciza tiene 41 años de edad, se describe como una persona bondadosa y sincera con las personas que en realidad se lo merecen. Narciza vive con su esposo y su hijo en Julio Andrade que se encuentra a 15 minutos de San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi.

Narciza trabaja sola en un puesto de venta de empanadas que son tortillas de harina con queso en el interior. Es el séptimo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de harina, huevos, queso para incrementar la producción de empanadas y también el crédito utilizará en la compra de una vaca para dedicarse a la venta de leche, esta inversión ayudará a Narciza a incrementar sus ingresos económicos y ayudar en los estudios de su hijo.

Narciza sueña con reconstruir su casa e incrementar en la crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Narciza is 41 years old and is described as a person who is kind and sincere with people who in reality merit it. Narciza lives with her husband and her son in the town of Julio Andrade, located 15 minutes from San Gabriel in Carchi Province.

Narciza works alone at a street post where she sells 'empanadas,' which are wheat tortillas with cheese inside. This will be her 7th loan through FODEMI, and will be used to purchase wheat, eggs, and cheese, to expand her production of 'empanadas.' Narciza will also use the loan to buy a cow in order to sell milk. This investment will help Narciza increase her income and help pay for her son's studies.

Narciza dreams of constructing her own house and expanding cattle raising.

loans.use: to buy wheat, eggs, and cheese to expand her snack business, and also, to purchase a cow to sell the milk.

loans.name: Myraflor

texts.en: Myraflor is single, 38 years of age, and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Myraflor is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and she earns 2,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Myraflor's business is very stable in her community. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Myraflor will use her income to support her daily needs. Myraflor wishes that the business would grow more.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 39 years old. She lives in Abovyan city with her brother and retired father. Almost a year ago, Ruzanna started her own business to have an independent and stable source of income. She works providing cooking lessons, makes wedding accessories, and she caters and designs food. 

Ruzanna is requesting a loan to develop her business; specifically, to start selling wedding dresses and accessories. Her loan will allow Ruzanna to increase her business income and she will invest her profits in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to start selling wedding dresses and accessories

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, 63, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carmelita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to continuously support her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
This is Precila, 36, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolly, an operator. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Precila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Precila hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to continuously support her child’s future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina lives in Yambio. She sells medical drugs, and has been in business for four years. She is 37 years old, married, and has five children.  Three of them are still in school. 

Penina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase drugs. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase medical drugs for sale.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Elenita is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Elenita owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elenita has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Miidie

texts.en:
Miidie lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Two of them are still in school. 

Miidie heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Uzinduzi Group

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her early 20s, is single.  She has been running a grocery store for three years now.  She works from 4:00 pm to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Neema's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more beer, juice, sodas, spirits and water to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to make her grocery store really big.

Neema will share this loan with loan group "Uzinduzi," which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more beer, juice, sodas, sprits and water to sell

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is 53 years old. She lives with her 58-year-old husband in Bagaran village, in western Armenia. The couple has been engaged in agriculture for 12 years. They raise cattle and have an orchard where they grow apricot and peach trees.

Heghine has applied for this loan to develop sheep breeding. She will use the loan requested to purchase 5 sheep. She plans to get additional income from selling sheep milk and meat. The extra income is important for her to improve her household and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Xiomara,  de 23 años, es una joven originaria de Estelí, se dedica a elaborar repostería. Inicio su negocio hace un año, este es su primer negocio, con capital propio. La experiencia la adquirió a los 17 años de edad cuando estuvo trabajando como practicante en una panadería  ahí se fue interesando un poco mas hasta especializarse en la elaboración de deliciosas y apetitosas repostería y postres los cuales venden con mucha demanda. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, polvo de hornear ya que es parte de la materia prima que necesita para elaborar sus productos.  Una de sus metas es comprar una batidora y en lo futuro tener su propio local para dejar de alquilar y reducir costos.
texts.en:
Xiomara,  23, is a young woman from Estelí who makes pastries. She started this business, her first, a year ago with her own capital. She gained experience while working, at 17, as an assistant in a bakery. There she became more and more interested in specializing in sweets. She makes delicious and appetizing pastries and desserts which are in high demand.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, and baking powder, since these are some of the primary ingredients for making her products. One of her goals is to buy a mixer and eventually to have her own shop so she can stop renting and reduce costs.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast and baking powder.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a twenty-six year-old woman. She is single and has one child. She has been selling second-hand clothes in Oloitoktok. She has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of 7630 shillings. 

This will be Purity’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more second hand clothes. With the profit that she will get, she wants to expand the business. 

In the future she wants to be able to own a big boutique business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  clothes  for sale

loans.name: Nama

texts.en:
Nama lives in Yambio. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 31 years old, married, and has four children;  Two of them are still in school.

Nama heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer . This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Elvelita

texts.en:
Elvelita is a 42 year-old married woman with eight children, who are between the ages of 2 and 17. She and her husband work together to feed their children and send them to school.

Elvelita is involved in farming and fishing. They grow rice crops and catch fish to sell.

Elvelita is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets. Elvelita hopes to have a stable income in order to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets.

loans.name: Efren Armando

texts.es:
Efren es una persona de 27 años de edad, se describe como una persona alegre y trabajadora. Efren vive con sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Tulcán que se encuentra en la Provincia del Carchi.

Efren tiene una tienda de víveres y vende al por mayor y por menor, este negocio ayuda a mantener los gastos de sus hijos, su educación ya que su única fuente de ingresos económicos. El crédito que ha solicitado a Fodemi es para la compra de víveres como quintales de arroz, azúcar, sal, fréjol, gaseosas, snaks, papas entre otros para surtir su negocio, esta inversión permitirá a Efren incrementar su clientela y a su vez sus ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

El sueño de Efren es seguir trabajando y que su negocio siga creciendo para el beneficio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Efren is 27 years old, and describes himself as a happy and hardworking person. Efren lives with his two children in the city of Tulcán, which is in Carchi Provence. Efren has a general store and sells wholesale and retail. This business helps meet his children's expenses including education, and it is his only source of income. 

The loan he is requesting from FODEMI is to purchase provisions such as hundred pound bags of rice, sugar, salt, beans, sodas, snacks, and potatoes, as well as other items to stock his store. This investment will allow Efren to increase his customer base as well as his income, and he will be able to improve his children's quality of life. Efren's dream is that he can continue working and that his business continues to grow for the benefit of his children.

loans.use: to make wholesale purchases of provisions such as rice, sugar, salt, beans, sodas, snacks, potatoes, and other items to stock his business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old. She is married to Mukabwa and together they have two children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is Grace's second loan.  She has repaid her previous loan successfully.  She will use this loan amount to purchase stock of cooking fat and school stationery to sell in her business.  She hopes to expand her business to a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: buy cooking fat and school stationery to sell

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.

Esterlina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.  In the future, Esterlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children -- all of them are still in school. 

Victoria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 4000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 3 years.  She also earns addition income from rice retailing.

Felisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: buy more snack foods to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Amelita works hard to support her family.   She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amelita is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 30 years old, married, and has two children currently going to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Warlita has a variety store business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 4 years.  Warlita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, snack food and other groceries.

In the future, Warlita would like to improve her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Evangeline requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en: 57-year-old Gorgonia is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 24 and 26. She is a farmer working in Bien Unido, Bohol. Gorgonia primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 3500 PHP per month doing this farming. Gorgonia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena  is a widow. She  lives with her  5 childern at Jukwa near Abura. Abena is a trader, She trades in vegetables,such as  garden eggs, and food items, which she has done for some years now.  Abena uses her  income for the general upkeep of her children.  Abena will use her loan to purchase more vegetables and food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more vegetables and food items to sell

loans.name: Zerifa

texts.en:
Zerifa lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 40 year old, married, and has five children -- all of them are still in school. 

Zerifa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El señor Adrian necesita mas espacio para sus dos hijos, ya que su casa es muy pequeña. Por lo cual esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material que es arena, cemento, varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Con este préstamo terminara de realizar el cuarto que será para sus niños.
Don Adrian es empleado de una empresa de seguridad privada, en al departamento de supervisor de personal, y su esposa lo apoya con las ganancias que obtiene de sus venta de productos de belleza, entre los dos han sacado a delante a sus hijos.
El propósito del señor Adrian es para brindarles una mejor protección a sus hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
Adrián needs more space for his two children because his house is small.  Because of this he’s asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies like sand, cement and rebar and to pay the person who will carry out the improvement.  With this loan he will be able to build a bedroom for his children.

Adrián is employed by a private security firm in the personnel supervision department and his wife helps out with income she earns selling beauty products.  Between the two of them, they’ve moved their children forward.  Adrián’s goal is to provide better safety for his children and his wife.

loans.use: to lay a concrete slab.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motor for his shaved ice cart.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evelyn owns and farms a plot of land, where she cultivates coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 14 years and earns PHP 2,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 3,400 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Evelyn has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Evelyn's plan is to save her returns in order to buy new plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
This is Guadalupe, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dedio, her business partner, and a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.     
                        
Guadalupe operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Guadalupe hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is from Ozamis Cty, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Anelyn is married and has a child. 

To make a living, Anelyn operates a "nata de coco" production business. She's been making "nata de coco" for six years and earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. Anelyn is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy ingredients such as food coloring, coconut, etc. 

In 2007, Anelyn joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as food coloring, coconut, etc.

loans.name: Colletta

texts.en:
Colletta lives in Yambio. She sells food in a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Colletta heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase maize flour and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and beans for sale.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elenita has a general store business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 8 years.   Elenita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, noodles, curls and other groceries to sell.

In the future, Elenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 18 years.  She also earns additional income from raising livestock and running a general store.   Eden is borrowing PHP 22,500 through NWTF to buy snack food to sell to customers. 

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy snack food to sell

loans.name: Alemar

texts.en:
Alemar is 34 years old and married with 4 children.   Alemar works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Alemar has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  Alemar has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. Alemar aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells salt at Jukwa near Abura. She has been selling salt for 5 years now. She lives together with her husband and 3 childen. She uses her income to assist her husband to feed and clothe their children.  

Patience will use her loan to purchase bags of salt to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of salt to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 44 years old and married with 4 children.   She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   She has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a ready-to-wear clothes business.

Beverly is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnulfo, a baker, and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                      
       
Lorena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Lorena is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lorena hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to sell

loans.name: Poulinah

texts.en:
Poulinah is a thirty-nine-year old lady.  She is married and has three children.  She owns a green grocery shop.  She has been in the business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of two thousand shillings.   

This will be Poulinah's first loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages to increase  her stock for sale.   With the profits, she plans to educate her children. In future, Poulinah wants to be able to be financially stable.

loans.use: purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children.

Hussein is a butcher since 2005, selling all kinds of meat. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Hussein is requesting a $3000 loan in order to repair and fix his shop’s walls and floors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: repaid his butcher shop

loans.name: Senderos De Luz Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Senderos de Luz esta integrado por cuatro socias que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas en la Aldea de Zopilotepe en el municipio de Juticalpa. La coordinadora de este Grupo Solidario se llama Julia Cecilia; se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, es casada, procreo tres hijas y es una persona muy conocida en la comunidad y cuenta con muy buenas referencia por parte de sus clientes y vecinos.

El primer negocio de Julia Cecilia era una librería pero no le fue bien y decidió dedicarse a otra actividad comercial. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para mujeres, hombres, niños y niñas, también tiene una maquina fotocopiadora que le genera unos centavos extras. Atiende su negocio ella misma y su jornada inicia a las 7:00 am y culmina a las 8:00 pm. Su mayor ventaja es que no descuida a su familia por su trabajo, ya que comercializa la ropa en su propia casa de habitación y no paga alquiler de ningun local.

Julia Cecilia solicita este préstamo para comprar fardos de ropa usada con estilos veraniegos y así poder llamar la atención de más personas en esta Semana Santa y de ese modo aumentar sus ventas. Esto será de mucho beneficia para ella y su familia. 

Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y diversificarlo con diferentes líneas de productos. Este es su quinto préstamo en FAMA y espera seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en:
"Grupo Solidario Senderos de Luz" [Paths of Light Solidarity Group] is made up of four members who work in different economic activities in the hamlet of Zopilotepe in Juticalpa municipality. Julia Cecilia is the coordinator of this Solidarity Group. She sells secondhand clothing, is married, has three daughters, and is a very well known figure in the community with very good references on the part of her customers and neighbors. 

Julia Cecilia's first business was a bookstore but it didn't do well and she decided to switch to a different business. Today she sells used clothes for women, men, boys and girls, and also has a photocopy machine which earns her a little extra. She tends her business herself, and her day starts at 7 am and ends at 8 pm. Her greatest advantage is that she doesn't neglect her family on account of her business, since she sells the clothing in her own home and doesn't have to pay rent for a shop. 

Julia Cecilia is requesting this loan in order to purchase bundles of used clothing in summery styles to attract more attention during Holy Week, and in this way increase her sales. This will greatly benefit her and her family. Her dream is to make her business grow and branch out into different product lines. This will be her fifth loan from FAMA and she expects to continue fulfilling her commitment by making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Adelina De Jesus

texts.es:
Adelina siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica. Es por esto que decidió montar su propio negocio con el cual pudiera contribuir económicamente en los gastos de su hogar, ya que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Adelina se encuentra casada y tiene 5 hijos que manifiesta son la motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio todos los días. Debido a que conocía la actividad de la crianza de cerdos, decidió comprar algunos cerdos para la crianza y posterior venta, y así sucesivamente fue creciendo el negocio hasta el punto en que pudo construir un espacio donde mantener los cerdos y cuidarlos de mejor manera. Actualmente su negocio sigue siendo una gran fuente de ingresos para su familia, y es por esto que Adelina quiere que su negocio siga creciendo. Con la finalidad de comprar el cuido necesario para los cerdos, y realizarle mantenimiento a la choza donde los cuida, Adelina busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para cerdos y realizar mantenimiento de la choza donde los cuida. 

Adelina espera que de esta manera su negocio siga creciendo y así los ingresos que siga generando le permitan ofrecerle a su esposo y sus 5 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adelina has always been noted for being a very hardworking person who always wants to offer her family a good quality of life and greater economic stability.  This is why she decided to set up her own business to contribute economically to her home’s support since the income her husband generated was insufficient to cover all household expenses.

Adelina is married and has five children who she says are the motivating factors for her to work hard every day in her business.  Because she knew how to raise pigs, she decided to buy some to raise for subsequent sale and this is how the business has been gradually growing to the point that she was able to build a space to keep her pigs in and care for them better. 

The business to date continues to be a great source of family income and this is why Adelina wants it to continue to grow.  Aiming at buying necessary feed for the pigs and to do some improvements to the shed she keeps them in, Adelina is looking for a loan to buy pig feed and to do some improvements on the shed she keeps them in.  Adelina hopes in this way that her business will continue growing and the income she continue to generate will allow her to give her husband and five children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and to make improvements on the pig sty.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
This is Gil, 41, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is single.  Gil manages his household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Gil operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pens, bond paper, cartolina (heavy colored paper) and the like, without going to a bookstore.  He gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece.  His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Gil is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more school supplies to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Gil hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Pedro Lorenzo Group
