texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PEDRO LORENZO esta conformado por nueve integrantes todas mujeres que se dedican a distintas actividades ya sea comerciales o de servicio, la presidenta es la Sra.  Maryluz  tiene 22 años no esta casada pero convive con su pareja todavía no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de comida ella vive en la comunidad de Pedro Lorenzo, de ahí el nombre del Banco de Emprendimiento,  este es el primera secuencia de su  préstamo con la institución, La Sra. Maryluz  utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como arroz, fideo, papa y aceite para la elaboración de sus comidas, Maryluz enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mas clientela y  utilizara los beneficios dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, La Sra. se encuentra muy feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras ya que en muchos casos son personas solas que sacan adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank Pedro Lorenzo is comprised of nine members--all women--who make their livings through various businesses in both the commercial and service sectors. 

The president of the group is Maryluz. She is twenty-two years old and unmarried though she lives with her partner. She doesn't yet have children. She makes her living selling food and lives in the community of Pedro Lorenzo, which is the origin of the name of the entrepreneurial bank. This is her first loan cycle with the organization. 

Maryluz will use this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, potatoes, and oil for the preparation of her dishes. Maryluz faces challenges in her business such as expanding her clientele. She will use the proceeds to improve her family's quality of life. Maryluz is very happy and grateful to the organization for the support it has given her and her fellow group-members, who are in many cases individual people who help their families get ahead.

loans.use: to buy consumables in order to prepare rich, delicious dishes.

loans.name: Modiere

texts.fr: Née vers 1988 à Kati, MODIERE est une célibataire sans enfant  qui vit chez sa grande sœur dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Du à des problèmes de famille, elle a prématurément abandonnée l’école pour s’accrocher aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la vente de tissus wax et autres depuis 3 ans auprès de sa grande soeur. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 10 mois.  Elle est a son 1er prêt individuel.  Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt: 10 pièces de tissus wax et diverses marchandises à Bamako. MODIERE est ambulante et effectue sa vente dans les différents quartier de la ville de Koutiala et en sa domicile, à une clientèle de femmes et d’hommes, très souvent à crédit. Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso,  subvenir à ses petits besoins  et élargir son activité avec le reste. Très ambitieuse, MODIERE a pour perspective d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus et d’autres produits au grand marché de koutiala.
texts.en:
Modiere was born around 1988 in Kati. She is single with no children, and lives with her older sister in the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region). She left school early, due to family problems, and took up revenue-generating activities, most notably the sale of wax and other types of fabric, work she has been doing for 3 years, with her sister.

In order to satisfy a growing clientele, Modiere decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso institution 10 months ago. This will be her first individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 10 pieces of wax fabric and various other items in Bamako.

Modiere is a street vendor and she sells her wares in the different districts of Koutiala town, as well as at home, to a clientele made up of women and men, mostly for credit. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 30 000 francs which she plans to use to repay the interest on her loan from Soro Yiriwaso, as well as to cover her basic needs. She would like to reinvest the rest of her profits into the expansion of her business. Very ambitious, Modiere intends to open her own shop selling fabrics and other products at the Koutiala Grand Market.

loans.use: to buy pieces of wax and embroidered fabric.

loans.name: Bertha Maria

texts.es:
Bertha anteriormente trabajaba en un restaurante cocinando y dado a que mantenía durante mucho tiempo de pie comenzó a enfermarse y se vio en la obligación de dejar su trabajo. Sin embargo, como el ingreso de su esposo no es suficiente para poder sostener los gastos del hogar donde conviven con sus 3 hijos, Bertha decidió abrir una tienda donde ofrece gaseosas, licores y demás productos para así seguir generando algunos ingresos que contribuyan en el sostenimiento de los gastos del hogar. Su tienda ha ido creciendo poco a poco y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le permite tener muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, y comenzar a vender productos de la canasta familiar, Bertha busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecer así una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas.

Bertha espera que de esta manera su negocio crezca cada vez más y sus hijos puedan gozar de las ganancias que les deje el negocio. Además, Bertha sueña con que su familia pueda tener una estabilidad económica y una calidad de vida mucho mejor que por la que atraviesan actualmente.
texts.en:
Previously, Bertha worked in a restaurant cooking and because she remained standing for so long she started to become ill and had to leave her job.  However, since her husband’s income was insufficient to cover all household expenses where they live with their three children, Bertha decided to open a store where she offers soft-drinks, liquor and other products to continue generating income to contribute toward household expenses.

Her store has been growing bit by bit and thanks to the good service she offers she’s managed to win over a large number of customers that means good sales for her.  Aiming to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and to start selling basic staple items, Bertha is looking for a loan to buy basic staple items to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and increase her sales.

Bertha hopes her business will grow as a result and that her children will enjoy the benefits the business produces.  In addition, Bertha dreams with her family having economic stability and a much better quality of life than they currently do.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock her store.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip plans to venture into another business of building rental houses alongside his transportation business.  He has requested for a loan worth KES 100,000 to purchase building materials for constructing rental houses on his plot of land.  The anticipated profit will help him expand his wife’s business kiosk. He dreams of being successful through the loans from KADET.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for constructing rental houses in his plot

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 62 years old and is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Joel also ventured into the "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business. He works hard to improve his income and sustain his family.

Joel is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and a motorcycle chain. Joel hopes to elevate his family's standard of living.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and a motorcycle chain

loans.name: Malisera

texts.en:
Malisera lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 40 year old, single, and has five children -- all of them are still in school. 

Malisera heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 900 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase more rice and beans to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa, 60, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Narcisa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Narcisa's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 5000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Narcisa is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Narcisa dreams to be able to give her three children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy products to resell

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old and is a married man with 6 children aged between 4 and 17. Jose has been a farmer for 15 years. He plants rice crops on his land and sells his harvest at his town's market. Jose is working hard to have a better income that will enable him to send all his children to school.

Jose has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Jose hopes for his family to experience a better quality of living.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives in Yambio. She sells bread and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children -- all of them are still in school. 

Rosa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase more bread to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase bread to sell

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 26 year old, single, and has four children -- all of them are still in school. 

Penina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lamyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children.

Lamyaa has been a tailor since 1996; she makes, repairs, or  professionally alters clothing such as suits, coats and dresses for women. She has more than 15 years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is be well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine and a split air conditioner. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children.

Assaad has been an owner of a car blacksmith's workshop since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yambio. She sells food in a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase maize flour and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, biscuits and canned goods. She earns about 2000 PHP per month with her store.

Josefina works hard to support her family of a husband and two children. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, and snacks. Josefina hopes this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, and snacks

loans.name: Nelly Sohamy

texts.es:
Nelly  es una joven emprendedora, cuenta con una edad de 22 años, se ha dedicado a ser comerciante haciendo sus ventas de la forma ambulante  teniendo ya varios años de labor en la venta de ropa como ser, pantalones de dama y caballeros, ropa interior, ropa de niños y también se dedica a la venta de lociones su zona de venta es las colonias cercanas de su lugar de donde reside.
Nelly esta solicitando el préstamo de 10,000.00 lempiras para poder comprar ropa como ser, pantalones de dama y caballeros, ropa interior, ropa de niños y también Lociones, ella cree que con el apoyo de este crédito podrá crecer económicamente y lograra ser una persona mas desarrollada económicamente.
el sueño de Nelly seguir trabajando esta convencida que solo de esa forma podrá construir su propia vivienda, 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Nelly is a young entrepreneur. She is twenty-two years of age and makes her living as a retailer, making her sales in the street. She already has several years experience selling clothing, including women's and men's pants, undergarments, children's clothes, and also lotions. She makes her sales in the neighborhoods near where she lives.

Nelly is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL so that she will be able to buy clothing such as women's and men's pants, undergarments, children's clothing, and also lotions. She believes that with the help of this loan she will be able to grow economically and will become a more economically developed person.

Nelly's dream is to continue working. She is convinced that this is the only way that she will be able to build her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy clothing such as women's and men's pants, undergarments, children's clothes, and lotions for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana-coura,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, d’habillements et du poisson frais.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.                                                                        
La cliente KADIATOU,  deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter une balle de friperie avec les revendeurs de Fana pour ensuite les revendre sur place à la maison et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married, have an average age of 32, on average 3 children and all live in traditional, extended family settings, in the town of Fana, district of Fana-coura, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

The women have gotten to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and bonds of friendship. They sell tubers, clothing and fresh fish. The Benkadi group is on its 5th group loan.

The customer Kadiatou, second from the left in the picture, plans to buy a bale of second-hand clothing from the resellers at Fana, so that she can sell them on from her own home and the market in Fana, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, some of which will be used to take care of her family's needs, and some of which will be reinvested in her sales business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto es un joven emprendedor que al encontrar tan pocas oportunidades laborales decidió montar su propio negocio en el cual ofrece accesorios para damas y niñas. El negocio lo inició hace apenas unos meses, y dado el poco capital con el que fue montado no ha podido ofrecer mucha variedad en sus productos, sin embargo, esta desventaja la intenta eludir ofreciendo una gran atención a sus clientes, lo cual le ha podido generar una gran recordación en sus clientes. En su negocio, Carlos Alberto ha podido tener muy buenas ventas con el buen servicio que ofrece, y espera que esto siga compensando la gran competencia que existe en el sector. Con el ánimo de aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece su negocio, Carlos Alberto busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de accesorios para dama y niña con lo cual pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Carlos Alberto espera que su negocio pueda ser muy competitivo y siga siendo un referente en su municipio. Además, Carlos Alberto sueña con tener un gran negocio en el cual pueda generar empleo y mejorar la condición de vida de muchas más personas.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is a young entrepreneur who finding few employment opportunities decided to set up his own business selling accessories for women and girls.  He started the business just a few months ago and given the little capital he had to set it up he’s not been able to offer much variety of products.  

However, he tries to get around this disadvantage by offering great service to his customers which has made him memorable in their eyes.  Thanks to the good service he offers, Carlos Alberto has been able to have good sales and he hopes this will continue making up for the great amount of competition that exists in his sector.  

Aiming at increasing the variety of products he offers in his business, Carlos Alberto is looking for a loan that will make it possible for him to purchase accessories for women and girls to offer a wider selection of products in his business.  

Carlos Alberto hopes that his business will be very competitive and continue to stand out in his town.  In addition, Carlos Alberto dreams with having a great business that he can generate employment with thus improving the living conditions of many more people.

loans.use: to buy women's and girls' accessories.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, who is also her business partner, and is a mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Bella operates a pineapple growing farm. She grows pineapple and some papayas on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the highlands where it is suited to grow pineapple and other fruits. She sells her products to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies, as well as to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Bella is requesting a PHP 10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bella dreams to be able to give her all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yambio. She sells food in a food stall and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Yambio. She sells food in a food stall and has been in business for four years. She is 33 year old, married, and has no children. 

Catherine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 900 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 61 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is married to Wesley. They have three school-going children.

Juliana has poultry and rental houses businesses. She has applied for her first loan to enable her  to buy more chickens to add to her stock for sale. She is optimistic that her business will do well after the loan.

She hopes to see her business do well and enable her to have enough income to support her family well.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia lives in Yambio. She sells charcoal and has been in business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children; two of them are in school. 

Lucia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabaly, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font exclusivement le commerce de poissons frais.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Sabaly sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du poisson frais.                                                                          
La cliente DJENEBA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 200kg de poisson frais avec les fournisseurs de Fana et de Dioïla pour ensuite les revendre sur place à la maison et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly group are all married, have an average age of 36, an average of 4 children, and all live in traditional, extended family settings, in the town of Fana, district of Banankabougou. They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and bonds of friendship. They sell fresh fish exclusively. The women of the Sabaly group are on their 3rd group loan, which will be used to buy fresh fish.

The customer, Djeneba - second from the left, standing up, in the picture - plans to buy 200 kg of fresh fish from the suppliers in Fana and Dioïla, so that she can then resell it from her own home and the market in Fana, for cash or credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, some of which will be used to take care of the family's needs, and some of which will be reinvested into her sales business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Lastenia Maria

texts.es: Lastenia de 43 años vive( machala ecuador ). Ella comenzó en una sociedad con varias personas . pero un dia decidió independizarse . y puso su negocio con pocas cosa y a medida que le fue bien fue aumentando su negocio. La dificultad que ella tiene es qy¿ue sus vecinos venden mariscos y el olor se entra a su negocio. Es casada tiene dos hijos su esposo era militar . trabaja todos los días con ganas y esfuerzo con la ayuda de su  esposo. A futuro ella anhela poder comprar una casa y incrementar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (platos fundas ).
texts.en:
Lastenia, 43, lives in Machala, Ecuador. She started out in a partnership with several people, but one day she decided to go out on her own. She started her business with a few items and as things went well her business expanded. One difficulty she has is that her neighbors sell seafood and the smell invades her business. 

She is married and has two children. Her husband was in the military, and now helps her with the business. She works hard, and enjoys her work every day. She yearns to someday buy a house and for her business to grow. With the loan she will purchase plates and bags.

loans.use: to purchase containers, spoons, and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make arepas and to service her cooking equipment.

loans.name: Delia Manuela

texts.es:
Delida Manuela tiene 51 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 28, 25 y 21 años de edad, viven en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Delida tiene un puesto de comida, Solicta el crédito para comprar una cocina industrial, juego de ollas grandes, treiciclo.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace mucha falta para poder trabajar para el bienestar de la familia.
Las compras lo realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es poder tener un restaurante de etiqueta con variedad de platos a la carta.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y ponerle ese cariño a la comida para que al cliente le guste.
En el tiempo libre le gusta cocinar y experimentar otros platos.
texts.en:
Delida Manuela, 51, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 28, 25 and 21 years old in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Delida has a food stand.  She’s asking for the loan to buy an industrial stove, a set of large cooking pots and a three-wheel cart.

With help from the loan she will buy what she very much needs to be able to work for her family’s wellbeing.

She will make her purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to be able to have a high-class restaurant with a variety of a la carte dishes.

The challenges she faces are competition and putting into her food that special touch of love so that her customers will like it.

In her free time she likes to cook and experiment with new recipes.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove, a set of large cooking pots and a three-wheel cart.

loans.name: Mithaq

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has one child.

Mithaq has owned a shop since 2010, selling spare parts for motorcycles. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1,800 loan in order to renovate his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Amuna

texts.en:
Amuna lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 38 years old, married, and has six children -- all of them are still in school. 

Amuna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
Rodrigo se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 7 años de edad, de quienes manifiesta son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente todos los días. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió la actividad de la crianza de ganado, por lo que siguió este camino y actualmente se sigue dedicando a esta actividad, con la cual genera los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Rodrigo además de su trabajo en la crianza del ganado, trabaja como empleado en una finca cerca de su residencia, lo que le permite tener unos ingresos extras para poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica. Rodrigo quiere que su negocio siga creciendo, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de ganado para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes.

Rodrigo espera que de esta manera el negocio siga creciendo y sus ingresos mensuales no se vean afectados. Además, Rodrigo sueña con seguir teniendo un buen negocio y que este cada vez sea más rentable, y desde este les pueda ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is married and has two children, ages one and seven.  He says that they are his motivation for working hard each day.  He learned to raise livestock at a young age and he followed this path and continues doing this today.  It generates him income with which to pay his household expenses.  Aside from his work raising livestock, he works on a nearby farm, close to his home.  This provides him with some extra income that allows him to provide a better quality of life and financial stability to his wife and two children.  Rodrigo wants to continue growing his business, so he is seeking a loan to buy livestock so that he can continue to offer it to his customers.

Rodrigo hopes that his business will continue to grow in this manner and that his monthly income is not affected.  Rodrigo also dreams of having a good, profitable business and that he will be able to provide a better quality of life and better advancement opportunities for his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
María Lucinda tiene 21 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 5, 3 y 1 años de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC MUSHUC ÑAN está ubicada en la comunidad Guanto Cruz parroquia Guanujo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 11 socios y socias se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza, insumos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá fumigar las hectáreas de terreno y salvar los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guanto Cruz. El sueño es poder comprar una camioneta para transportar los productos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son el mal clima y las plagas cómo el cogollero, la langosta y el ratón.

En el tiempo li8bre le gusta descansar y disfrutar de la época navideña.
texts.en:
Maria Lucinda is 21 years old, and lives with her husband and her 5, 3 and 1 year old children in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province of Ecuador.

She is a member of the Village Resource Center (VRC) MUSHUC ÑAN, which is located in the community of Santa Cruz in the parish of Guanujo. The Center is 60 minutes from the office made up of 11 partners, all of whom make a living in agricultural work cultivating blackberries and corn, as well as raising farm animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Maria is a corn farmer, and she also raises animals. She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea, weed killer and other supplies. The support from this loan will help her to fumigate her land and save her crops.

She buys and sells products in Guanto Cruz, and her dream is to be able to buy a truck to transport her goods. She faces challenges such as bad climate and pests like budworms, locusts and rats. In her free time, Maria likes to relax and enjoy the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea, weed killer and other supplies.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena es una persona que gracias a su amor por el trabajo ha podido superar grandes adversidades que le ha presentado la vida. Madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo hacen que Luz Elena sea una persona muy comprometida y luchadora que siempre busca en su trabajo la manera de generar ingresos con los que pueda ofrecer a su hijo una buena calidad de vida. Anteriormente, trabajaba como operaria en una empresa de confecciones, pero por el mal pago que recibía decidió montar su propio negocio donde actualmente ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y esporádicamente comienza a sacar su línea propia de confecciones. En su taller genera 1 empleo directo y esto hace que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida a personas diferentes de su hogar, y esto la enorgullece. Con el ánimo de seguir creciendo con su taller, Luz Elena busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina industrial para la confección y la compra de insumos que requiere para la confección en su taller.

De esta manera Luz Elena espera seguir creciendo y seguir generando puestos de trabajo en su taller, además de seguir generando ingresos con los cuales su hijo pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luz Elena has overcome the great adversities that life has presented her largely because she loves her work. Being the single mother of one child and head of the household, Luz Elena must be dedicated and persevering. She is always seeking ways to generate more income through her work so that she can offer her child a better quality of life. Previously, she was a machine operator for a tailoring company. Due to the low pay she earned, she decided to open her own business, where she offers tailoring to others and occasionally produces her own fashion designs.

She employs another person in her workshop, which allows her to improve the living conditions for other people in her home and makes her proud. With the intention of growing her business, Luz Elena is seeking a loan which will allow her to purchase an industrial sewing machine and the tailoring supplies she needs for her workshop.  In this way, Luz Elena hopes to keep growing her business and creating jobs. She also hopes to generate more income so that her child can enjoy a better life and more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and the tailoring supplies she needs for her workshop.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Anteriormente, Marta y sus 2 hijos dependían totalmente de los ingresos que generara su esposo, sin embargo, en un momento los ingresos no fueron suficientes para poder pagar los crecientes gastos de sus hijos que generaban los estudios universitarios. Es por esto que Marta decidió montar un negocio con el cual pudiera generar ingresos con los cuales contribuyera económicamente a los ingresos de su hogar y desde los cuales tuviera la oportunidad de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Marta comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catálogo y ya hace aproximadamente 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la que ha generado los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente, Marta ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenos niveles de ventas, además de que por su buen servicio al cliente ha logrado atraer cada vez mas clientela a su negocio. Con el ánimo de responder a unos grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, Marta busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal para poder responder a los grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

Con esto, Marta espera que su negocio siga creciendo y siga generando ingresos con los cuales pueda seguir aportando en su hogar a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Marta tiene el sueño de que su negocio le siga generando ingresos con los cuales le siga pagando a su hijo los estudios universitarios y este se pueda graduar.
texts.en:
Marta is a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking and wanting to provide her family with a good quality of life.  Previously, Marta and her two children depended totally on the income her husband generated.  However, the time came when his income became insufficient to cover the growing expenses for her children’s university studies.  Because of this, Marta decided to set up a business that would generate income she could contribute economically toward household expenses and have the opportunity to offer her family a better quality of life.

Marta started selling personal use products via catalogue and has been in business for about 17 years generating income needed to cover household expenses.  Currently, Marta has won over a large number of customers which has led to good sales levels.  Besides, her good customer service has led to her attracting more customers each time.  Aiming at filling some large customer orders, Marta is looking for a loan to buy personal use products to respond to the large pending customer orders she has.

With this, Marta hopes that her business will continue to grow and generate income that she can continue contributing to her home and to have a better quality of life.  Marta’s dream is that her business continues generating income she can use to continue to pay for her son’s university studies and that he will be able to graduate.

loans.use: to buy personal use products.

loans.name: Milona

texts.en:
This is Milona, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Noel, an engineer, and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milona maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Milona dreams of expanding her business and helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. 

Jawad has been the owner for a food market since 2011, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Jawad is requesting $2400 loan in order to make showcases and shelves and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: make showcases and shelves for his store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a thirty-six-year-old  married  man with three children.  He owns a garage business that deals in mixing paints in Kangemi. He has been in the business for twelve years now and gets a monthly income of forty-five thousand shillings.

This will be Henry's first loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale.  With the profit that he will get, he wants to open another shop.  In the future, he wants to make his family happy.

loans.use: buy paint for his auto repair paint shop

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for one years. She is 25 years old, single, and has no child.

Sara heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Serakazi Group

texts.en:
Melkiory, who is in his mid 30s, is married.  He has been running a genge duka (selling sugar, beans, wheat flour, salt, cigarettes, sweets, tomatoes, bananas, oranges, avocados, Irish potatoes, etc) since 1998.  He works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Melkiory's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy stocks of missing items.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase on his business stock.  His dream is to one day be able to own a supermarket.

Melkiory will share this loan with his loan group "Serakazi," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has no child.

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and beans to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy onions and beans to sell

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer lives in Yambio. She sells fish and has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children -- both of them are still in school. 

Jenifer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase more fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Yambio. She has a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 29 years old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. 

Angelina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Lura

texts.en:
Lura lives in Yambio. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 36 years old, single, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Lura heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 42 years old. He lives in Pokr Vedi village with his wife, mother and 3 children. Armen runs a farm of 2.8 hectares where he cultivates wheat, tomato, cucumber and watermelon crops. Armen's wife and mother help him with the daily agricultural activities. Armen has been involved in farming for 12 years. 

Armen has applied for this loan to start land cultivation. With the help of this loan, he plans to purchase  tomato and watermelon seeds and fertilizer. Armen is full of hope that he will gather a rich harvest and get increased income from its sales. With additional income, Armen plans to renovate his house and create more prosperous conditions for his family.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Brigada Group

texts.es: Kelineth, 23 años de edad, divorciada, se dedica al comercio. Ella tiene venta por catálogo hace dos años, sin ayuda de nadie ella visita a sus clientas y les ofrece los productos. Kelineth desea el crédito para comprar los productos y tenerlos en su casa para mostrarlos a sus clientas. Eligió Fundación Mujer porque tienen bajas tasas de interés, buen trato y la buena atención.
texts.en:
Kelineth is 23 years old and divorced, and has her own business. She has run a catalog sales business for the past two years, and without outside help she visits her customers and offers them a variety of products.

Kelineth is requesting this loan so that she can purchase sample products and have them in her house to show to her customers. She chose Fundación Mujer because they have low interest rates and treat their borrowers well.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Zaida Jubentina

texts.es:
Zaida Jubentina, tiene 37 años de edad, es viuda, madre de 3 hijos y reside en la Aldea de San Nicolás, en el municipio de Juticalpa. Hace doce años el primer negocio de Zaida Jubentina fue la venta de ropa de forma ambulante pero descuidaba mucho a sus hijos así que decidió dedicarse a otra actividad comercial. 

En la actualidad tiene una venta de abarrotería en general en su casa de habitación, ella atiende su negocio y sus hijos la ayudan después de la escuela, su jornada laboral inicia a las 6:00 am y culmina a las 6:00 pm. Su mayor ventaja es que no descuida a su familia y es muy conocida por sus vecinos.

Zaida Jubentina solicita este préstamo para surtir su pulperia de más y variados productos como ser: lácteos, carnes, verduras, pan, pastas, salsas, condimentos, refrescos, galletas, churros, arroz, manteca, frijoles, entre otros productos de uso doméstico. 

Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y apoyar a sus hijos para que se profesionalicen. Este es su treceavo préstamo en FAMA y espera seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Zaida Jubentina is 37 years old, and is a widow and the mother of three children. She lives in the town of San Nicolás, in the municipality of Juticalpa. She started her first business two years ago selling clothing in local street markets. Since she was unable to spend time with her children while working that job, she decided to find an alternative business.

Today, she has a general store based out of her house where she works every day from 6:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. Her children help her in the store when they get home from school. For her, the greatest advantage of this new job is that she does not neglect her children, and she knows her neighbors well.

Zaida Jubentina is requesting this loan to further stock her store and offer a greater variety of products, such as: dairy items, meat, vegetables, bread, pastas, sauces, condiments, drinks, cookies, churros, rice, butter, beans and other items for daily use.

Her dream is to grow her business and support her children in their professional development. This is her thirteenth loan with FAMA, and she hopes to continue with punctual payments as she has done consistently in the past.

loans.use: to purchase grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Nora Cecilia

texts.es:
Nora inició con su restaurante hace aproximadamente 18 años cuando se asoció con su hermana y empezaron a ofrecer alimentos como chorizos, tamales, empanadas, desayunos, bebidas calientes entre otros. Gracias a este trabajo Nora generaba los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con sus 3 hijos y a quienes su padre abandonó hace un tiempo. Posteriormente Nora se separó de su hermana y continuó trabajando sola el restaurante, el cual gracias al buen servicio que presta Nora sigue siendo un gran referente en su municipio. El restaurante, debido al tiempo que lleva operando, requiere de hacerle algunos mantenimientos; es por esto que Nora busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a realizar adecuaciones locativas a su restaurante y comprar un refrigerador.

Nora espera que su restaurante siga creciendo y siga siendo un referente para las personas en el municipio. Además, Nora espera que con los ingresos que le sigue generando el restaurante sus hijos puedan acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nora started her restaurant about 18 years ago when she partnered with her sister and they started to offer meals like sausages, tamales, turnovers, breakfasts and hot beverages, among others.  Thanks to this work, Nora generated income needed to sustain her home where she lived with her three children whose father had abandoned them some time ago.  

Later on, Nora separated from her sister and continued running the restaurant by herself.  Thanks to the good service Nora provides it continues to stand out in the town.  

Because of the time the restaurant has been in operation, it needs to have some upgrading and this is why Nora is looking for a loan to do some structural improvements and to buy a refrigerator.  

Nora hopes that her restaurant will continue to grow and continue to be a place of note with townspeople.  Also, Nora hopes that with income the restaurant continues to generate her children will have a better quality of life and economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to do some structural improvements to her restaurant.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Yambio. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 26 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Lucy heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase more fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Koroma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Koroma” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mabinty. Mabinty is thirty-seven years old.  She was born in Malon village but she is currently residing in Magburaka, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for six years now. She sells rice, biscuits, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy rice, biscuits, sugar, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, biscuits, sugar, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Because Of Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Because Of” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Fatu is the leader of this group. The forty-five-year-old is married to a teacher and they have five school-going children. Fatu has been a businesswoman for twenty-one years now. She is currently selling onions, peppers, tomatoes, etc.  

With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy onions, peppers, tomatoes, etc. at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana , Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de poissons frais, de fruits et des tubercules.                                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                          
NOUMOUTENIN,  première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter deux paniers de poisson frais avec les fournisseurs de Fana et de Dioïla pour ensuite les revendre sur place à la maison et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through family, friendship and neighborhood ties. They prepare food for sale and sell fresh fish, fruits and yams. The members of the Danaya group are on their third solidarity loan.

Noumoutenin, the first one standing on the left, plans to buy two baskets of fresh fish from suppliers from Fana and Dioila in order to resell them locally, out of her home and at the Fana market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. 
She plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 75,000, which will be used for family needs, with part of the revenues reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an oven and three griddles for making arepas so he can meet the market demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy personal use products to fil pending customer orders.

loans.name: Juanita Cecilia

texts.es: Juanita de 45 años vive ( paraíso Guayaquil) ella empezó en un curso de belleza . le gusto entonces decidió ponerse su propio negocio en casa. A parte juanita tiene un bazar en el cual le va muy bien. Ella trabaja todos los días con esfuerzo y dedicación. A futuro ella desea mejorar sus negocios. Con el préstamo comprara ( perfumes tintes etc).
texts.en: Juanita is 45 years old and lives in Guayaquil (Paraíso). She took a course in hair styling that she enjoyed, so she decided to open her own business in her house. She has a separate shop and has done very well. She works hard every day and hopes to improve her business in the future. With this loan, she will buy perfumes and dyes.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and dyes.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 46 years old. She lives with her family: her husband and five children. Rice husbandry is a vital business for the family and its sole income. Chea, together with her spouse, is able to earn in the neighborhood of 4.00 USD per day. Four of her children live under the same roof with her and depend on her income. 

One of Chea’s son works as apprentice repair person for a car garage in Phnom Penh city. He has worked and practiced car fixing there for a few years, and now he has enough skills to become independent. As it’s a great opportunity now, Chea’s son wants to set up a business and open a proper place to act himself as the main car repair person there. However, he doesn’t have enough capital to attain his goal.

To help her son achieve this goal, Chea decided to ask for a loan from HKL to add to her existing savings to open a small garage for her son so he can provide car fixing service. She hopes that he’ll be able to get success with this investment.

loans.use: open a car repair garage for her son

loans.name: New London Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “New London” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are each requesting for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand on the size and quality of their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Haja. Haja is thirty-six years old.  She was born in Manepeh village but she is currently residing in Magburaka together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Haja has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells clothes, shoes, plastic bowls, dishes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy clothes, shoes, plastic bowls, dishes, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is at the age of 40. She is a local rice farmer in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She grows especially rice in both seasons of the year. She is married and has five children, four are single and one is married.

In order to develop her business, Im would like to borrow some funds to rent a few hectares of land and hire two people to till the land. With the generated income, she will use it to cover her daily expenses and save some of it to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to rent land and pay labor

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin was married with six children but now she has become a single parent. She is 48 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province. Yin is a farmer and grows rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for almost 20 years. 

Yin has requested a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to pay for rented farmland and to purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides. She has been a client of HKL for four years and this is her third loan. She hopes to expand her business in the coming years.

loans.use: rent farmland and buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Tatayyira Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tatayyira” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Maseray is the leader of this group. This thirty-eight-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has four children. Maseray has been a businesswoman for seven years now.  She sells market-food – pepper, onions, salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy pepper, onions, salt, margi, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Alicia desea tener mas espacio en su casa y ampliarla poco a poco ya que la obtuvo por medio de un crédito gubernamental. Solo tiene dos recamara y le esta haciendo falta otra, ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar el material que es cemento, varilla, arene, block y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de construir el cuarto, que será para su hija. 
Doña Bertha Alicia es empleada de un despacho de contadores y su esposo el supervisor de una fabrica en el control de calidad de la producción. Entre los dos saben que trabajando pueden mejorar el patrimonio y la calidad de vida de sus niños.
texts.en: Bertha Alicia wants to have more room in her house and to add on to it little by little. She got the house by means of a government credit. It only has two bedrooms and needs another, since her children are growing and need their own space in the house. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase materials such as cement, rods, sand, and blocks, and to pay the person in charge of building the room, which will be for her daughter. Bertha Alicia works in an accounting office and her husband works as a supervisor for quality control at a factory. Between the two they know that by working they can increase their wealth and improve their children's quality of life.

loans.use: to begin construction of a room on the upper floor.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres tiene experiencia de aproximadamente unos 7 años trabajando en bares y restaurantes, pero un día decidió que no quería seguir trabajando para otra persona debido a que pagan muy mal un trabajo de mucho esfuerzo. Fue así como inició su negocio que es un bar donde ofrece toda clase de bebidas a sus clientes y donde, gracias a la buena atención que ofrece Andres, han tenido como referente este lugar. Andres se ha esforzado mucho por sacar su negocio adelante y clara muestra de ello es que inició su negocio con muy bajo capital, pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando algunas condiciones de su negocio que requieren de alguna mejora y seguir así creciendo poco a poco. Debido a que requiere hacer algunas remodelaciones en su bar, de modo que pueda atender a más personas, Andres busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a realizar arreglos locativos en su negocio y poder atender a más personas en su bar.

Andres espera que su negocio siga creciendo y con esta remodelación pueda seguir atendiendo a más personas en su bar. Además, Andres sueña con tener un gran negocio donde pueda emplear a muchas personas que tengan dificultades para acceder a un empleo y requieran de unos ingresos.
texts.en:
Andres has about seven years’ experience working in restaurants and pubs, but one day he decided that he didn’t’ want to continue working for someone else because they didn’t pay well for hard work.  This is how he came to start his own pub where he offers all types of beverages to his customers and thanks to Andres’ good service, people have liked this place.

Andres has worked hard to move his business ahead and it shows.  He started his business with a small amount of capital, but he’s been improving some areas of his business that needed improving and it’s been growing little by little.  He is asking for this loan so that he can do some remodeling that will allow him to serve more customers in his pub.

Andres hopes that his business will continue to grow with this remodel so that he can continue serving more people in his pub.  Andres also hopes to have a large business where he can employ many people who have trouble finding jobs and need an income.

loans.use: to remodel his pub.

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria se encuentra casada y es madre de 4 hijos a quienes siempre ha soñado con poderlos ver profesionales, para lo que trabaja fuertemente para poder darles el sostenimiento de sus estudios universitarios. Anteriormente, el negocio lo trabajaba su padre, pero después de su muerte, Gloria quedó a cargo del negocio de la compra y venta de posilla (semillas de almendras), negocio con el cual ha podido generar ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gloria conoce muy bien la actividad del negocio, pues trabajó junto a su padre por aproximadamente 30 años, por lo que en el momento de quedar a cargo de este hizo lo mejor posible y el negocio aún sigue siendo una gran fuente de ingresos. Debido al poco capital con el que contaba Gloria, y a algunas deudas que tenía el negocio, apenas hace un tiempo ha venido presentando algunas ganancias y por esto se ha dificultado la consecución de capital de trabajo. Es por esto que ahora que el negocio ha salido de algunas crisis y puede seguir su marcha normalmente, Gloria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una báscula para su negocio.

Gloria espera que de esta manera pueda seguir ofreciendo un mejor servicio en su negocio y pueda seguir aportando económicamente en su hogar. Gloria sigue trabajando fuertemente en su negocio con el ánimo de poder cumplir el sueño de ver a sus hijos profesionales y también cumplir el sueño de poder comprar un carro donde transporte su producto.
texts.en:
Gloria is married and the mother of 4 children, whom she has always hoped to see become professionals. She works very hard to provide the money for their university studies. Previously, her father worked in the business. After his death, Gloria was in charge of buying and selling the posilla (almond seeds). The business has generated income to financially sustain the household.  Gloria understands the business very well because she had worked with her father for about 30 years. When she because responsible for the business, she did her best, and it continued being a great source of income.  However, Gloria had very little capital and some business debts. So the business has barely provided profits, and she has had difficulty getting working capital. The business has recently emerged from a crisis and is back to operating normally. 

Gloria is seeking a loan so that she can purchase a scale for her business. Gloria hopes to continue offering great service and to financially support her household. Gloria will keep working very hard with the intention of seeing her children become professionals. She also hopes to achieve her dream of purchasing a car to transport her product.

loans.use: to buy a scale for her business.

loans.name: Tamtamnehsu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamtamnehsu” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mariatu is the leader of this group. Mariatu is forty years old and married with four children – one in primary school and three in secondary school. Mariatu sells used clothes and mobile phones; she has been a businesswoman for twelve years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying used clothes and mobile phones to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and mobile phones to add to her current stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 53 years old and married to Samuel. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to plant seedlings and purchase fertilizer for use on the farm. Hannah hopes to become a large-scale farmer to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Love Each Other Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Love Each Other” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,200,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their businesses.

Hawanatu is the leader of this group. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are attending primary school. Hawanatu sells clothes, shoes, bags, etc., and with the help of this loan, she will purchase more clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes, shoes and bags for her business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, who lives in Yambio, has been selling breads for five years. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in in school.

Sara learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is now requesting her first loan for 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase more breads. She will use the resulting extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase breads to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 62 years old, is from Njambini where he is married to Joyce; they have one daughter, Milka, who is in form four. Julius is a farmer and has also run a retail shop for the past 11 years. He is now requesting his sixth loan from KADET LTD. to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm and sugar, tea leaves, cooking ingredients, etc. for his retail shop.

Julius hopes to be the area's leading farmer in the near future and also hopes that his shop will continue to do well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and animal  feeds for his farm, and sugar, tea leaves, cooking ingredients, etc. for his retail shop.

loans.name: Abahujumugambi Twese / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Evariste est membre du groupe ABAHUJUMUGAMBI TWESE / RBV. Il est marié, âgé de 38 ans et a 7 enfants dont le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a une année. Quatre de ses enfants vont à l'école et aucune autre personne est en sa charge. Son niveau d'éducation est 8 ans de l'école primaire.
Il a adhéré à ACB en 2012. Le cycle actuel est le premier pour lui. Il est agriculteur des maïs.
Le crédit qu'il a obtenu lui a permit de payer la main d'oeuvre des gens qui ont cultivé son champs. Il a aussi acheté 38kgs des maïs pour la semance et 5 kgs d'angrais chimiques. Il a une stratégie d'acheter un autre champs pour augmenter la capacité de son agriculture. Avec cette stratégie, il va pouvoir atteindre son ambition d'être le premier dans ce secteur agricole. Le profit sera utilisé pour construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Evariste is a member of the ABAHUJUMUGAMBI TWESE / RBV group. He is married, 38 years old, and has 7 children. The oldest of his children is 12 and the youngest is one. Four of his children are in school, and he has no other dependent children. He has 8 years of elementary school education.

He joined ACB in 2012, and this is his first loan cycle. 

He is a corn farmer. The credit he received helped him him pay for labor for people who cultivated his field. He also bought 38kg of corn seeds and 5kg of chemical fertilizers. 

He has a plan to buy another field to increase the size of his farm. With this plan, he will be able to reach his goal of being the first to do so in this agricultural sector. He will use the profits to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pay for labor, and buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: "santisima Trinidad" Group

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia de 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Tiene 3 años y medio con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de Joyas desde hace 5 años. Comenzó por motivación de uno de sus hijos, quien le inspiro a dedicarse a este negocio. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, ha podido dar una carrera superior a uno de sus hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina en la inversión de su negocio, mientras que su esposo cubre todos los gastos de casa. Su plan para el futuro es expandir su negocio. Ella usará el crédito en la inversión para su negocio, ya que en esta temporada tiende a aumentar sus ventas. Patricia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Santísima Trinidad”, el cual tiene 3 años y medio desde que se formó y está conformado por 7 personas. Ella comienza recién como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Patricia is 46 years old, is married, and has three children who still depend on her. 

She has been with Edaprospo for three and a half years and has been selling jewelry for five years. Her motivation to get started came from one of her children, who inspired her to go into the business. Through her effort and hard work, she was able to give one of her children a higher education. Currently she is reinvesting her income in her business, while her husband covers all home expenses. 

Her plan for the future is to expand her business. She is going to use this loan to invest in it, because sales tend to increase during this season. Patricia belongs to the communal bank “Santísima Trinidad”, which was founded three and a half years ago and comprises seven people. She recently became president of the group.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lourdes Jeaneth

texts.es:
Doña Lourdes, es madre soltera, tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas  y vive junto a ellas en su propia casa de habitación en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras.
Doña Lourdes su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y calzado como ser pantalones, camisa de hombre y de mujer, faldas, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior de dama y caballero, sandalias para niña y mujer, zapatos, tenis entre otros accesorios en el mercado municipal de su pueblo, en la zona sur de Honduras.
Doña Lourdes esta solicitando la cantidad de 5,000.00 lempiras para la compra de pantalones, camisa de hombre y de mujer, faldas, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior de dama y caballero, sandalias para niña y mujer, zapatos y otra mercadería para surtir más su negocio de esta manera generar mayores ventas, por lo que sus ingresos serán mejores.
Doña Lourdes entre sus sueños principalmente esta la idea de construir un mejor local para su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother, is 45 years old, and has two daughters. She lives with them in her own home in the province of Valle in southern Honduras.
Lourdes sells new clothing and shoes such as pants, men and women's shirts, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, men and women's underwear, girls and women's sandals, shoes, tennis shoes, and other accessories at the local market in her town, in the southern area of Honduras. 

Lourdes is requesting an amount of 5,000.00 lempiras tu purchase pants, men and women's shirts, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, men and women's underwear, girls and women's sandals, shoes, and other merchandise in order to further stock her business so that sales may increase and improve her income.

Lourdes' dreams mainly include the idea of building a better site for her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase pants, men and women's shirts, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, men and women's underwear, girls and women's sandals, shoes, and other merchandise for her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 65 years old and widowed. She has eleven children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, shampoo, beverages, and other groceries.  Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Amuna

texts.en:
Amuna lives in Yambio. She has a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Amuna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luisa lives in Yambio. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Luisa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a Kiva borrower. He has two children, ages 1 year and 4 years. He describes himself to be a determined and diligent man.
